data: Sabbath Valley lay like a green jewel cupped in the hand of the surrounding mountains with the morning sun serene upon it picking out the clean smooth streets, the white houses with their green blinds, the maples with their clear cut leaves, the cosy brick school house wide winged and friendly, the vine clad stone church, and the little stone bungalow with low spreading roof that was the parsonage.
browsing: literature|browsing: religion/spirituality/paranormal|browsing: fiction|category: crime, thrillers and mystery|category: adventure|category: novels
